intro: Argentina glabriuscula var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the Argentine glabriuscula, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often found in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in temperate regions.
